member.name: M:InitialDLauncher.AudioFile.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor: Location is the filename of the media to play. Wave files and Mp3 files are the supported formats.

member.name: M:InitialDLauncher.AudioFile.Play
member.summary: Plays the file that is specified as the filename.

member.name: M:InitialDLauncher.AudioFile.Pause
member.summary: Pause the current play back.

member.name: M:InitialDLauncher.AudioFile.Resume
member.summary: Resume the current play back if it is currently paused.

member.name: M:InitialDLauncher.AudioFile.Stop
member.summary: Stop the current file if it's playing.

member.name: M:InitialDLauncher.AudioFile.Close
member.summary: Close the file.

member.name: P:InitialDLauncher.AudioFile.Wait
member.summary: Halt the program until the .wav file is done playing. Be careful, this will lock the entire program up until the file is done playing. It behaves as if the Windows Sleep API is called while the file is playing (and maybe it is, I don't actually know, I'm just theorizing). :P

member.name: P:InitialDLauncher.AudioFile.Milleseconds
member.summary: Sets the audio file's time format via the mciSendString API.

member.name: P:InitialDLauncher.AudioFile.Status
member.summary: Gets the status of the current playback file via the mciSendString API.

member.name: P:InitialDLauncher.AudioFile.FileSize
member.summary: Gets the file size of the current audio file.

member.name: P:InitialDLauncher.AudioFile.Channels
member.summary: Gets the channels of the file via the mciSendString API.

member.name: P:InitialDLauncher.AudioFile.Debug
member.summary: Used for debugging purposes.

member.name: P:InitialDLauncher.AudioFile.IsPaused
member.summary: Whether or not the current playback is paused.

member.name: P:InitialDLauncher.AudioFile.Filename
member.summary: The current filename of the file that is to be played back.

member.name: T:InitialDLauncher.Dropshadow
member.summary: Dropshadow. Add a shadow to a winform

member.name: P:InitialDLauncher.Dropshadow.OffsetX
member.summary: Offset X relate to Owner

member.name: P:InitialDLauncher.Dropshadow.OffsetY
member.summary: Offset Y relate to Owner

member.name: M:InitialDLauncher.Dropshadow.RefreshShadow(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Refresh shadow.

member.name: M:InitialDLauncher.Dropshadow.SetBitmap(System.Drawing.Bitmap,System.Byte)
member.para: Changes the current bitmap with a custom opacity level. Here is where all happens!

member.name: M:InitialDLauncher.Win32.SetWindowLong(System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Changes an attribute of the specified window. The function also sets the 32-bit (long) value at the specified offset into the extra window memory.
member.param: A handle to the window and, indirectly, the class to which the window belongs..

The zero-based offset to the value to be set. Valid values are in the range zero through the number of bytes of extra window memory, minus the size of an integer. To set any other value, specify one of the following values: GWL_EXSTYLE, GWL_HINSTANCE, GWL_ID, GWL_STYLE, GWL_USERDATA, GWL_WNDPROC
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is the previous value of the specified 32-bit integer. If the function fails, the return value is zero. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.
